data.title: Fix aircraft repulsing other aircraft when not being repulsable themselves
Increase planes' CruiseAltitude in cnc
data.body:
In order to fix `A10`'s pushing `orcas`/`apaches` out of the way.
(See [Sleipnir's Stuff - TD balance thread](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=292015#292015).)

data.title: Map preview duplication
data.body:
Map browser shows preview duplicates after each save within the editor if there were any changes made (does not apply if you just keep saving the map without making changes to it). This does not create extra files, it fills the menu with extra previews which all point to the same file.

![testmap_ra](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2159248/10428625/20fa7f06-70f3-11e5-9d2e-067e216987e5.jpg)

data.title: Toggling team chat should have its own hotkey
data.body: Currently, tab is used for both player name completion and switching between team chat and all players chat. It would be better if team chat had its own hotkey.

data.title: Remaining D2k changes to restore original balancing/gameplay
data.body:
#9458 + this should wrap up the implementation of @OmegaBolt's PR.

Don't let the number of commits intimidate you, I split everything I could into individual commits for easier reviewing.

data.title: Use spatial partitioning to speed up frozen actors
data.body: One of our biggest perf hogs is FrozenActorLayer, which checks every frozen actor for visibility every tick.  We could save a lot of perf by tracking dirty flags for each bin in a spatial partition, and only ticking the frozen actors that are in dirty bins.

data.title: Replace Rearm and Repair activities with condition-based solutions
data.body:
Activities cannot be executed in parallel, so in order to replenish health and ammo at the same time, this is necessary.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27332964-replace-rearm-and-repair-activities-with-upgrade-based-solutions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Change the default stance to Defend for human players
data.body:
Exceptions are dogs and stealthy things.

Closes #3285.

Thanks to @matija-hustic for laying the groundwork that makes this work properly in the first place!

data.title: Tab completion improvement/rewrite
data.body:
Tab completion can now properly handle elements (most likely usernames) with whitespace. Previously, if someone had a nickname "I like lamp", and one types "I li+tab", it wouldn't work. Another pet peeve tackled!

I'm not super satisfied with it because I would have liked to avoid rebuilding `relevantSubstrings`, but I didn't really find a more elegant solution. (Suggestions welcome). It might be impossible though because of the immutability of strings and the not-worthiness of having a "startsWith()" helper function that works on char arrays.
It's O(n*m) (worst case) where m is the average length of the possible elements (nicknames).

I rewrote a good section of the class to increasing modularity and reduce the need to handle corner cases (although some remnants linger). Commands and Names are now in different `TabCompletionLogic` objects.

data.title: CustomSelectionSize might be broken
data.body: #9607 indicates it doesn't work as intended.

data.title: Show spectators somewhere in the ingame UI
data.body:
This can be useful for diagnosing lag issues, or just knowing who is still around.  The ingame menu stats panel is probably the best place.

data.title: Fixed long bridge demolition
data.body:
Reverts https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/c23ee1be2e58bcc512ceb106d56a619bab48eb33#diff-0e19aa72642d1c8ffcf6cc9c47e4471c.

Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9592.

data.title: Add ReloadAmmo trait, remove Rearm activity and rename Repairable
data.body:
This is the first out of 2 (maybe 3) PRs to replace the `Rearm` and `Repair` activities with upgrade-based solutions (#9613).

Note1: Although the commits should work on their own, the later commits make improvements over the first in some cases, keep that in mind while reviewing.

Note2: I'll write upgrade rules for both the `Repairable` -> `Resupplyable` rename and the `AmmoPool.SelfReloads` -> `ReloadAmmo` once I'm sure there won't be further changes to trait names or larger changes requested.

data.title: Added support for speech variants to CanPowerDown
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9602 and cleans up the surroundings.

data.title: Map-placed actors in "Tread Lightly" have bogus health
data.body: They all define Health: 0 or 1. Looks like they might have been affected by a bad / multiply applied upgrade rule.

data.title: Fix tanya not being able to damage barrels
data.body: Fixes #9591.

data.title: Add a Lua wrapper to display debug messages (shows if setting enabled)
data.body:
Addresses #9598.

Can be tested in lua with `Media.Debug()`

data.title: Rename "Show Bot Debug Messages" & expose debug messages to Lua
data.body:
it would be useful to have toggle-able debug messages in single-player missions which could remain in the code after merging - this could serve as a way to comment the mission code as well

This could be tied to the "Show Debug Messages"-Setting (maybe prefix the messges with "Lua: "?), but in that case the setting should be renamed to something like "Show Bot/Lua Debug Messages")

(currently I'm using Media.DisplayMessage for debugging and removing them before pushing)

data.title: Mouse wheel zooming
data.body: This change adds support for mousewheel zooming, with a minimum zoom level of 0.5 (half of the current) and a maximum of 4.0 (double the current).

data.title: Added support for mousewheel zooming (similar to Supreme Commander)
data.body: This change adds support for mousewheel zooming, with a minimum zoom level of 0.5 (half of the current) and a maximum of 4.0 (double the current).

data.title: Middle click to cancel directly (skips onhold) & ctrl+cancel to cancel entire queue
data.body:
Implemented a fix to a pet peeve which is having to go through "onhold" before cancelling an item. Especially frustrating during lag spikes (and misclicks of adding extra units/structures). If we middle click instead of right click, we can now directly cancel an item without interrupting the currently building/training item. This also gives us a lot more versatility in fixing up the queue for long term construction projects. 

I also implemented `ctrl + click` to cancel an entire queue, resolving #6082.
- `Ctrl + leftclick` doesn't do anything (trains one unit, except if it's `ctrl + shift + leftclick` which behaves as `shift + leftclick`.
- `Ctrl + middleclick`: immediately cancels the whole queue (without going to "onhold")
- `Ctrl + rightclick`: goes to onhold if not already there. If already in onhold, cancels the entire queue.

Just a note: If someone gets the bright idea of implementing modifiers for keyboard hotkeys (like shift+f1 to train 5 items, or ctrl+f1 to cancel an item or something, then it's an exercise in futility since ctrl+f1 won't match the hotkey for the building at all, since it could be binded to something else anyway :p). It's debatable if we care enough to look for some solution to this.

data.title: glitch with transport units
data.body: if you select many empty transport units like chinook or apc, in some of those, units are displayed sometimes

data.title: Tanya can't easily target a bridge to use C4
data.body: there only seems to be specific locations where you can place the c4 on the bridge. this only seems to affect bleed.

data.title: Tanya can't damage explosive barrels
data.body:
as the title says Tanya can not damage explosive barrels. I have identified a potential solution, but not sure if this is the appropriate fix.

Looks like the Warhead@1Dam: SpreadDamage of Colt45 needs to be changed to

```
ValidTargets: Ground, Infantry
```

instead of 

```
ValidTargets: Infantry
```

data.title: Fix debug menu terminology.
data.body: Fixes #9375 and a polish regression introduced by #8700.
